refnamediv.refpurpose: A FLTK widget opcode that creates a button that executes a command.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A FLTK widget opcode that creates a button that executes a command. Useful for opening up HTML documentation as About text or to start a separate program from an FLTK widget interface.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: Because any command can be executed, the user is advised to be very careful when using this opcode and when running orchestras by others using this opcode.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ihandle FLexecButton "command", iwidth, iheight, ix, iy

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ihandle -- a handle value (an integer number) that unequivocally references a corresponding widget. This is used by other opcodes that modify a widget's properties (see Modifying FLTK Widget Appearance). It is automatically output by FLexecButton.
command -- a double-quoted string containing a command to execute.
Notice that with FLexecButton, the default text for the button is "About" and it is necessary to call the FLsetText opcode to change the text of the button.
ix -- horizontal position of upper left corner of the valuator, relative to the upper left corner of corresponding window (expressed in pixels).
iy -- vertical position of upper left corner of the valuator, relative to the upper left corner of corresponding window (expressed in pixels).
